text: walls breaking up a building
disappearing models three stories high
suddenly zooming into the sky above the
ralph lauren store in London's Bond
Street it's called architectural mapping
a new way to engage with customers and
to promote the brand in a truly
revolutionary way I do believe this can
be a game-changer it is the beginning of
something very new what we have done is
created a concept that makes people
think very differently about how
technology can be used and it's no
longer limited to an iPhone or an iPad
or a computer today technology can exist
in space I spoke to David law and
earlier today about the impact of the
digital world on the Ralph Lauren Empire
David Lauren you're here in London to
celebrate a birthday the celebration now
is for your high-tech operations tell us
about them well we started
ralphlauren.com 10 years ago the
internet was just beginning and in fact
it had started and then we actually
started into the sort of the bubble
bursting and most people were very
apprehensive about going online most
companies were putting up marketing
sites but they didn't want to sell
online and we really were one of the
first brands to come along and fused
merchandising and marketing and combine
them and we called it merchant amen
what we do on line is we show the
product we sell the product and then we
create context around it so you can see
how the models where you can see the
worlds in which they live it people want
that outfit because they want entree
into that world so now you can buy the
product you can read about the dog that
she has on her lap you can watch a video
about the car you can book a trip to
that house were created a virtual
experience or a real experience now to
literally step into a Ralph Lauren
advertisement your father Ralph Lauren
must have taught you a lot of things in
your 39 years but when it comes to the
Internet is it you who's taught your
father Ralph Lauren is a very big
believer in the internet and right from
the start when everyone was apprehensive
he said this is the future of the
company the truth is is that I'm
surrounded by an amazing team of people
who are much more technically savvy than
I am I'm really not very good on a
computer and that's no secret in our
office my lack of understanding my
questioning what's possible is sometimes
what drives everyone because sometimes
someone will show me something so here's
what we're working on I said why can't
you do this and like I get it of course
the reason that your hair in London now
is to launch the UK website is this a
big step for you and is it leading to
the wide world yes it's the Gateway to
the rest of Europe and then into Asia
and our goal
really is to to make sure that the
marketing and the brand and the product
assortment is right and to keep learning
from each market and keep growing David
Lowe and thank you very much for talking
to the New York Times and the
International Herald Tribune thank you
